gettingStarted.welcome: Welcome to the D&D Character Creator – Crafting heroes made easy.
gettingStarted.explainer:
Our tool is designed to make character creation a breeze while ensuring your character is unique and well-defined. Wiz-Rad guides you through a series of questions that help you determine your character's race, class, ability scores, personality, and equipment. 

   With Wiz-Rad, you won't need to flip through rulebooks or worry about all the details. Instead, you'll focus on shaping your character's story and personality. 

Your character sheet will be filled out automatically as you answer questions about the role you want to play.

explainer.details: The race you choose influences your character's physical traits, abilities, and cultural background, shaping how you interact with the game world and your role within it. For example, being a dwarf might make you more resistant to poison, or being an elf could grant you keen senses, all of which can impact your role in different situations.

q1.q: Do you want your character to be short or tall?

Short: Short and sturdy characters often excel in strength and resilience, adapted for close combat and enduring physical challenges.
Tall: Tall and agile characters possess grace and nimbleness, excelling in agility and precision, well-suited for ranged combat and finesse-based tasks.

q2.q: Do you want to play as both a human or half-human, or would you rather play as a beast?

More Like A Human: Short and sturdy characters often excel in strength and resilience, adapted for close combat and enduring physical challenges.
More Like A Creature: Tall and agile characters possess grace and nimbleness, excelling in agility and precision, well-suited for ranged combat and finesse-based tasks.

See in the dark: Magical abilities provide characters with access to spells and arcane knowledge, allowing them to manipulate reality through incantations. Classes like Wizards and Sorcerers harness raw magical energy.
Breath fire (or other elements): Characters with a strong connection to nature, such as Druids and Rangers, draw power from the natural world. They communicate with animals, shape-shift, and wield nature-based spells. Their magic is closely tied to the elements and ecosystems.

alignment.description: Alignment guides a character's decisions and role-playing, influencing their behavior and interactions within the game world. It's a tool for players to define their character's beliefs and values, helping to shape their role-playing experience and relationships with other characters and NPCs. However, alignment is flexible and may evolve as the character's story unfolds, allowing for dynamic character development.

options.Lawful Good: Principled and compassionate, guided by a strict moral code for the greater good.
options.Neutral Good: Altruistic and kind, valuing goodness and empathy without rigid rules.
options.Chaotic Good: Rebellious champions of freedom and kindness, often defying authority.
options.Lawful Neutral: Upholds order and society, focusing on rules and structure over morality.
options.True Neutral: Balanced and impartial, avoiding extremes and embracing nature's balance.
options.Chaotic Neutral: Unpredictable and self-interested, cherishing personal freedom above all.
options.Lawful Evil: Ruthlessly ambitious, using structure and laws to achieve dark goals.
options.Neutral Evil: Self-serving and ruthless, driven by personal gain with no moral qualms.
options.Chaotic Evil: Chaotic and destructive, driven by violence and chaos for its own sake.

misc.race: Every character has a lineage. The race you are assigned contributes to your characters identity and influences the abilities you possess.
misc.class:
Class broadly describes a character’s vocation and the tactics the character is likely to employ when exploring, fighting and negotiating. 

    Classes also determine the benefits you will receive. We will choose a class that receives benefits based on your preferred playstyle.
misc.ability scores: Much of what your character can do is determined by your ability scores. The six abilities are Strength, Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma.
misc.personality: Once you have the basic game aspects of your character, you'll need to consider who your character is as a person. You'll give them a name, an alignment and background. Keep this in mind when answering questions.
misc.equipment: With a good idea of who your character is, you can choose what they will need on their adventure. Equipment includes armor, weapons, gold and useful tools.
misc.character sheet: A character sheet is used in tabletop role-playing games, like Dungeons & Dragons, to record and organize a player's character information. It includes details such as a character's name, race, class, abilities, skills, equipment, and backstory. Character sheets are essential for tracking a character's progress, abilities, and decisions throughout the game, serving as a reference point for players and game masters during gameplay.
